items.name: CREL
items.description: FDCAN Core Release Register

items.name: ENDN
items.description: FDCAN Core Release Register

items.name: DBTP
items.description: This register is only writable if bits CCCR.CCE and CCCR.INIT are set. The CAN bit time may be programed in the range of 4 to 25 time quanta. The CAN time quantum may be programmed in the range of 1 to 1024 FDCAN clock periods. tq = (DBRP + 1) FDCAN clock period. DTSEG1 is the sum of Prop_Seg and Phase_Seg1. DTSEG2 is Phase_Seg2. Therefore the length of the bit time is (programmed values) [DTSEG1 + DTSEG2 + 3] tq or (functional values) [Sync_Seg + Prop_Seg + Phase_Seg1 + Phase_Seg2] tq. The Information Processing Time (IPT) is zero, meaning the data for the next bit is available at the first clock edge after the sample point.

items.name: TEST
items.description: Write access to the Test Register has to be enabled by setting bit CCCR[TEST] to 1 . All Test Register functions are set to their reset values when bit CCCR[TEST] is reset. Loop Back mode and software control of Tx pin FDCANx_TX are hardware test modes. Programming TX differently from 00 may disturb the message transfer on the CAN bus.

items.name: RWD
items.description: The RAM Watchdog monitors the READY output of the Message RAM. A Message RAM access starts the Message RAM Watchdog Counter with the value configured by the RWD[WDC] bits. The counter is reloaded with RWD[WDC] bits when the Message RAM signals successful completion by activating its READY output. In case there is no response from the Message RAM until the counter has counted down to 0, the counter stops and interrupt flag IR[WDI] bit is set. The RAM Watchdog Counter is clocked by the fdcan_pclk clock.

items.name: CCCR
items.description: For details about setting and resetting of single bits see Software initialization.

items.name: NBTP
items.description: FDCAN_NBTP

items.name: TSCC
items.description: FDCAN Timestamp Counter Configuration Register

items.name: TSCV
items.description: FDCAN Timestamp Counter Value Register

items.name: TOCC
items.description: FDCAN Timeout Counter Configuration Register

items.name: TOCV
items.description: FDCAN Timeout Counter Value Register

items.name: ECR
items.description: FDCAN Error Counter Register

items.name: PSR
items.description: FDCAN Protocol Status Register

items.name: TDCR
items.description: FDCAN Transmitter Delay Compensation Register

items.name: IR
items.description: The flags are set when one of the listed conditions is detected (edge-sensitive). The flags remain set until the Host clears them. A flag is cleared by writing a 1 to the corresponding bit position. Writing a 0 has no effect. A hard reset will clear the register. The configuration of IE controls whether an interrupt is generated. The configuration of ILS controls on which interrupt line an interrupt is signaled.

items.name: IE
items.description: The settings in the Interrupt Enable register determine which status changes in the Interrupt Register will be signaled on an interrupt line.

items.name: ILS
items.description: The Interrupt Line Select register assigns an interrupt generated by a specific interrupt flag from the Interrupt Register to one of the two module interrupt lines. For interrupt generation the respective interrupt line has to be enabled via ILE[EINT0] and ILE[EINT1].

items.name: ILE
items.description: Each of the two interrupt lines to the CPU can be enabled/disabled separately by programming bits EINT0 and EINT1.

items.name: RXGFC
items.description: Global settings for Message ID filtering. The Global Filter Configuration controls the filter path for standard and extended messages as described in Figure706: Standard Message ID filter path and Figure707: Extended Message ID filter path.

items.name: XIDAM
items.description: FDCAN Extended ID and Mask Register

items.name: HPMS
items.description: This register is updated every time a Message ID filter element configured to generate a priority event match. This can be used to monitor the status of incoming high priority messages and to enable fast access to these messages.

items.name: RXFS
items.description: FDCAN Rx FIFO X Status Register

items.name: RXFA
items.description: CAN Rx FIFO 0 Acknowledge Register

items.name: TXBC
items.description: FDCAN Tx Buffer Configuration Register

items.name: TXFQS
items.description: The Tx FIFO/Queue status is related to the pending Tx requests listed in register TXBRP. Therefore the effect of Add/Cancellation requests may be delayed due to a running Tx scan (TXBRP not yet updated).

items.name: TXBRP
items.description: FDCAN Tx Buffer Request Pending Register

items.name: TXBAR
items.description: FDCAN Tx Buffer Add Request Register

items.name: TXBCR
items.description: FDCAN Tx Buffer Cancellation Request Register

items.name: TXBTO
items.description: FDCAN Tx Buffer Transmission Occurred Register

items.name: TXBCF
items.description: FDCAN Tx Buffer Cancellation Finished Register

items.name: TXBTIE
items.description: FDCAN Tx Buffer Transmission Interrupt Enable Register

items.name: TXBCIE
items.description: FDCAN Tx Buffer Cancellation Finished Interrupt Enable Register

items.name: TXEFS
items.description: FDCAN Tx Event FIFO Status Register

items.name: TXEFA
items.description: FDCAN Tx Event FIFO Acknowledge Register

items.name: CKDIV
items.description: FDCAN CFG clock divider register

fieldset/CCCR.description: For details about setting and resetting of single bits see Software initialization.

fields.name: PDIV
fields.description: input clock divider. the APB clock could be divided prior to be used by the CAN sub

fields.name: RFNE
fields.description: Rx FIFO X new message enable

fields.name: RFLE
fields.description: Rx FIFO X message lost enable

fields.name: TEFNE
fields.description: Tx even FIFO new entry enable

fields.name: TEFLE
fields.description: Tx event FIFO element lost enable

fields.name: PEAE
fields.description: Protocol error in arbitration phase enable

fields.name: PEDE
fields.description: Protocol error in data phase enable

fieldset/ILE.description: Each of the two interrupt lines to the CPU can be enabled/disabled separately by programming bits EINT0 and EINT1.

fieldset/ILS.description: The Interrupt Line Select register assigns an interrupt generated by a specific interrupt flag from the Interrupt Register to one of the two module interrupt lines. For interrupt generation the respective interrupt line has to be enabled via ILE[EINT0] and ILE[EINT1].

fields.name: RXFIFO
fields.description: RX FIFO bit grouping the following interruption

fields.name: SMSG
fields.description: Status message bit grouping the following interruption

fields.name: TFERR
fields.description: TX FIFO error grouping the following interruption

fields.name: BERR
fields.description: Bit and line error grouping the following interruption

fields.name: PERR
fields.description: Protocol error grouping the following interruption
